variant.name: OnPointerHoverWithMotionEstimator
variant.summary: Predictor based on pointer hover, except if the pointer velocity and acceleration suggest it will leave soon. The output of this predictor is mouse velocity instead of a logit/probability.

variant.name: OnPreloadingHeuristicsMLModel
variant.summary: The estimated probability that a user will click on a link that is calculated by preloading heuristic ML model.

variant.name: BackButtonHover
variant.summary: When the user hovers their mouse over the back button.

variant.name: BackGestureNavigation
variant.summary: When overscroll that could trigger a back navigation starts.

variant.name: ChromeCustomTabs
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by CCT prefetch API.

variant.name: DefaultSearchEngine
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered from the default search engine suggest service.

variant.name: LinkRel
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by the 'rel' keyword embedded in the link element.

variant.name: MouseBackButton
variant.summary: When a mouse down of a mouse back button is seen.

variant.name: MouseHoverOnNewTabPage
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by mouse hover NewTabPage on Desktop.

variant.name: MouseHoverOrMouseDownOnBookmarkBar
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by mouse hover bookmarkbar or mouse down bookmark bar.

variant.name: OmniboxDirectURLInput
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered from the Omnibox DUI.

variant.name: OmniboxMousePredictor
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered from the default search suggest due to mousedown on a Omnibox Search suggestion.

variant.name: OmniboxSearchPredictor
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered from the default search suggest due to change in Omnibox selection.

variant.name: PointerDownOnAnchor
variant.summary: When a pointerdown event happens on a HTTP/HTTPS anchor.

variant.name: PointerDownOnNewTabPage
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by mouse down NewTabPage on Desktop.

variant.name: PreloadingHeuristicsMLModel
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by an ML model prediction.

variant.name: SpeculationRules
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by the speculation rules.

variant.name: TouchOnNewTabPage
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by Touch events on Android.

variant.name: UrlPointerDownOnAnchor
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by OnPointerDown.

variant.name: UrlPointerHoverOnAnchor
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by OnPointerHover.

variant.name: ViewportHeuristic
variant.summary: When preloading is triggered by a deterministic viewport-based heuristic.

histogram.name: Preloading.Experimental.UpdateSpeculationCandidatesReason
histogram.summary: This metric counts the number of the update of speculation rules preloading, classified by the reason for updates. Currently, this is introduced to measure the overall impact of BFCache retrigger(crbug.com/1449163). This metric is recorded when UpdateSpeculationCandidates is called on DocumentSpeculationRules.

histogram.name: Preloading.Experimental.{ExperimentalPreloadingPrediction}.{GroundTruth}
histogram.summary: The output of many predictors is a logit score. To use this score for binary classification, we compare it to a threshold. If the score is above the threshold, we classify the instance as positive; otherwise, we classify it as negative. Threshold choice affects classifier precision and recall. There is a trade-off between precision and recall. If we set the threshold too low, we will have high precision but low recall. If we set the threshold too high, we will have high recall but low precision. To choose the best threshold, we can use ROC curves, precision-recall curves, or logit-precision and logit-recall curves. `ExperimentalPreloadingPrediction` helps us collect the UMA data required to achieve this.

histogram.name: Preloading.Predictor.{PreloadingPredictor}.Precision
histogram.summary: After the user starts a new navigation, the outcome of the {PreloadingPredictor} preloading predictor is recorded as a true positive or a false positive. These statistics are used to compute precision of the preloading predictor. The statistics about negative cases are not required to compute the precision and are not recorded here.

histogram.name: Preloading.Predictor.{PreloadingPredictor}.Recall
histogram.summary: After the user starts a new navigation, the outcome of any eligible {PreloadingPredictor} preloading predictor is recorded as a true positive or a false negative. These statistics are used to compute recall of the preloading predictor. The statistics about false positive and true negative cases are not required to compute the recall and are not recorded here.

histogram.name: Preloading.Prefetch.PrefetchDataPipeTeeCloneFailed.{PrefetchDataPipeTeeStateLoadingOrSizeExceeded}
histogram.summary:
Records how many times `PrefetchDataPipeTee::Clone()` is called when the method failed.
{PrefetchDataPipeTeeStateLoadingOrSizeExceeded} indicates `PrefetchDataPipeTee::State` at the failure.
It is used for investigation crbug.com/374039756.

histogram.name: Preloading.Prefetch.PrefetchDataPipeTeeDtorState
histogram.summary:
Records the `PrefetchDataPipeTee::State` at `PrefetchDataPipeTee`'s destructor.
It is used for investigation crbug.com/374039756.

histogram.name: Preloading.Prefetch.PrefetchResponseReaderCreateRequestHandlerInvalidBody
histogram.summary:
Records `true` when `PrefetchResponseReader::CreateRequestHandler` couldn't get valid `body`. `false` is never recorded.
It is used for investigation crbug.com/374039756.

histogram.name: Preloading.Prefetch.PrefetchStatus
histogram.summary: Records the final PrefetchStatus value for a PrefetchContainer. The value is recorded when a prefetch fails (in the failure case), or when the PrefetchContainer is destroyed (in all other cases).

histogram.name: Preloading.PrefetchBCGSwap.RelatedActiveContents
histogram.summary: Records the number of active contents in the same BrowsingInstance as a frame which is, or would be, swapped to a new one due to use of a cross-site prefetch, when this determination is being made on navigation. The proportion of these which is greater than 1 is a rough upper bound for the cases where this might be observable due to an opener relationship.

histogram.name: Preloading.PrerenderBackNavigationEligibility.{PreloadingPredictor}
histogram.summary: Records whether prerendering a back navigation is possible at the time of the prediction of a back navigation by {PreloadingPredictor}.

histogram.name: Preloading.{PreloadingType}.Attempt.{PreloadingPredictor}.Precision
histogram.summary: After the user starts a new navigation, the outcome of the preloading attempt of type {PreloadingType} that is triggered by {PreloadingPredictor} is recorded as a true positive or a false positive. These statistics are used to compute precision of the preloading attempt. The statistics about negative cases are not required to compute the precision and are not recorded here.

histogram.name: Preloading.{PreloadingType}.Attempt.{PreloadingPredictor}.Recall
histogram.summary: After the user starts a new navigation, the outcome of any eligible preloading attempt of type {PreloadingType} that is triggered by {PreloadingPredictor} or the lack of an attempt by an eligible predictor is recorded as a true positive or a false negative. These statistics are used to compute recall of the preloading attempt. The statistics about false positive and true negative cases are not required to compute the recall and are not recorded here.

histogram.name: Preloading.{PreloadingType}.Attempt.{PreloadingPredictor}.TriggeringOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the triggering outcome of a preloading attempt of type {PreloadingType} and triggered by {PreloadingPredictor} that happened on the previous page load at the time a new navigation is started.
